2 But the fault lies at the door of the individuals who have con- sented to the act, not to those who were outvoted by the others. For the punishments of individuals and of the general body are different. As the punishment of individuals is sometimes death, so it is the punishment of a city to be destroyed, which is done when the civil body is dissolved; of which case we have spoken elsewhere.
